alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:26PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Marshall, northwestern Benton and southern Fayette Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 226 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mt Pleasant, or 12 miles southeast of Collierville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lamar, Mt Pleasant, Lagrange, Michigan City, Slayden, Piperton, Rossville, Moscow, Williston, La Grange, Hudsonville, Early Grove, Taska, Atway, Hays Crossing, Pattersonville, Forty Five and Ghost River State Natural Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
